h:Text.text: This app exists to permite crowd sourced voting on the output from the Cherokee-TTS project.
This goal of the Cherokee-TTS project is to generate massive amounts of correctly pronounced audio learning materials.
After enough votes are collected, a new training run will be initiated, with new results posted here.
Listen carefully to each audio track.
If you hear any type of defect such as noise, sudden fade in volume, etc, you should mark the track as 'Bad'.
If the pronunciation does not match the supplied text, you should mark the track as 'Bad'.
If you hear vowels not in the text, or don't hear vowels which are in the text, you should mark the track as 'Bad'.
Any type of mis-pronunciation should be marked as 'Bad'.
If the pronunciation matches the supplied text, but if any part the audio is 'iffy', you should mark the track as 'Poor'.
If the pronunciation matches the supplied text, and the audio is clear, you should mark the track as 'Good'.
If you are unsure about what vote to use, you should mark 'No Vote'.
When satisfied with your results, hit 'SUBMIT', your votes will be recorded, then a new set of audio tracks will be displayed.
If you hit 'CANCEL' your votes will be discarded. Hit 'VOTE' when you are ready for the next set of audio tracks.
